alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 03 at 9:37AM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Henry, Clay, Randolph and Quitman Counties through 1115 AM EDT/1015 AM CDT/... At 1037 AM EDT/937 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Osco to near Gaino to near Blue Springs. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Georgetown, Cuthbert, Bellville, Shorterville, Wire Bridge, Carnegie, Watson Crossroads, Scottsboro Crossroads, Ricks Place, Pecan, Thomas Mill Creek, Hatcher, Morris, Bethel, Suttons Corner, Springvale, Fort Gaines-Clay Airport and Wades. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
